Tho is leading a loan group of two members who are both first time borrowers with Kiva partner VisionFund. They are seeking a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 KHR. As a group representative, Tho will use 1,000,000 KHR, his portion of the loan, to purchase fertilizer and to run a small business which buys and sells trash. After receiving his portion of the loan, Tho hopes that he can earn more income from his rice-growing business as well as from the business which buys and sells trash.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Keav's Group

texts.en: Keav is a villager living in Dambae district located in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of two children, including one son who is her dependent. To offer a decent life for her beloved family, Keav works two jobs. She is a farmer who plants cassava on a two-hectare plot of farmland, and she sells grocery items. Keav has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles already. With her previous loans, she succeeded in relieving the burdens of her family and supporting her businesses. Now she is leading a female group member, Sina, to take out a group loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As a group representative, Keav will utilize her portion to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. This industrious mother, Keav, hopes that in the near future she will be able to improve the living standard of her family and build a warm house in which her family can live.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom, aged 64, is a citizen of Thmor Koul district located in Cambodia’s Battambang province. He is the single father of one child. To continually support his family, Prom works so many jobs. He raises pigs, farms rice, and buys and sells trash. Prom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four previous loan cycles, with which he succeeded in relieving the burdens of his beloved family. To strengthen and expand his pig-raising business, Prom is applying for a KHR 1,500,000 loan. With the requested loan, he will buy pig feeds and more piglets to raise. With the help of this loan, Prom expects that his pigs will be healthier and fatter so that he can earn greater profits from this pig-raising business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: A 32-year-old married woman, Sokhom is a villager living in a rural area of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is the mother of two dependent daughters, both of whom are school-aged children. Sokhom makes her living by farming rice and planting cassava. She has been in this business for four years, and she earns around 18,000 KHR daily of which she is able to save only 2,000 KHR for future needs after deducting their living expenses. This will be Sokhom’s fifth loan request via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have helped her to better support the family. To better support her farming business, Sokhom is leading a female group member named Srey Mab, who has already been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, to take out a group loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Sokhom will utilize her loan to purchase fertilizer, to pay wages to farm laborers, and to cover household expenses. After receiving the requested loan portion and effectively using it, this hard-working woman believes that her business will provide her with a good-quality crop so that she can boost her income. Sokhom is willing to use the anticipated income to move her family ahead, build an appropriate house, and, most importantly, advance her children’s education further.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, to pay wages to farm laborers, and to cover household expenses

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. She is married and has five children. Two of her daughters  are school-aged children and are still dependent on her. To provide resources for the family, Sokny farms rice and plants cassava, which enables her to earn about USD 14 per day. This will be Sokny’s second loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her previous loan helped her to improve the living standard of her family. Sokny is now requesting a USD 1,500 loan to buy fertilizer and to pay wages to farm laborers. This industrious woman dreams of running another business in the future: growing rubber. Sokny would love to dedicate the effort that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead and supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay wages to farm laborers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chai Hun

texts.en: A villager residing in a rural area of Kror Kor district in Cambodia’s Pursat province, Chai Hun is 21 years of age and married. To make a living, she works as a grocery seller and as a paid worker. Chai Hun’s husband also works as a rice farmer and as a paid worker in order to supplement the family’s income. Chai Hun is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is applying for a KHR 2,000,000 loan to support her husband’s rice-growing business. Chai Hun will spend the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the help of this loan, Chai Hun hopes that her husband can smoothly run his rice-growing business, which enables him to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been a widow since 2000. Despite her situation as a single parent to her seven children, she is still able to sustain their needs. Her eldest is married, two children are engaged in a farming business, two of them are still studying, and the other two are working.

Josefina is a beautician and manicurist within her local community. She has been doing this since she was 18 years old. Josefina struggles through hardships in life because she's the only one who will look after the seven children. Though she doubled her effort, her profit is still not sufficient due to the large number in her household.

Josefina doesn't stop believing that she can make her business more profitable and well known someday. To make her goal possible, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy chemicals for hair rebonding and curly hair. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan so she can have a better way of living and increase the profit she generate from her business.

The borrower on the picture wear brown shirt while the person in white shirt is her costumer.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for hair rebonding and curly hair.

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en:
Bunly is aged 41 years and married with one dependent daughter who is still under school-age. His family lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he has been farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland for seven years. Bunly can earn about 27,000KHR per day but he can manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 
This is the first loan for Bunly with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying cows to help him in his farming business. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a high yield from his paddy-rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland and to buy cows to help him in his farming business

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea, 42, is a rice farmer who lives in a rural area of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has farmed rice and planted water convolvulus while her husband works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for seven years, Sokea and her husband are able to earn about US$10 per day and manage to save about US$3 each day after deducting their daily expenses.

Sokea has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She has smartly used the previous loan to better support her family with enough food. Now she is seeking another loan of US$500 to buy a cow for helping her in the farming business. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to keep up the improvement in her lifestyle and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for helping her in the farming business

loans.name: Sokhoern

texts.en:
Sokhoern, 34, lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and in school. 

Rice farming and cassava planting are the main sources of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 14 years. The current business earns approximately KHR 70,000 per day and she can save about KHR 30,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Sokhoern is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy a plot of farmland for expanding her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her paddy field.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for expanding her farming business.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan is 42 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making and selling creel for more than four years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Nan requests a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children attain higher education. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nach

texts.en:
Nach is a 45-year-old married mother who lives with her husband and three children. They reside in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of the Kandal province in Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has one daughter to take care of because she is still in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice for twenty years. Their family daily income is approximately $8 per day, and they can manage to save about $3 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Nach has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her current business so as to make a better living. Now, she is applying for a loan of $700 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on a pumping machine. She hopes to make more money from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ont

texts.en:
Ont is 35 years old and a married mother, who has been blessed with three children. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. She resides in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, Ont and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava, while her husband earns extra income for the family by working for others for a fee. Having engaged in this business for 13 years, Ont and her husband can earn approximately KHR 9,000 per day, and they manage to save about KHR 3,000 each day after paying daily living expenses. 

Ont is a first-loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan of KHR 1,500,000. With this loan, she wants to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor to help with her crops. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully, so as to sell it for a good price and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor to help with her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan is 24 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in a fish store for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband is employed as a manual worker, making an income of $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Khan requests a loan of $1300 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive, providing taxi service. This purchase will help him generate extra income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a tuk-tuk to provide public transportation, and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use in providing taxi services.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of the Kandal province. To make a living, she farms rice on one hectare of farmland, and her husband works as a cook to earn additional income for the family. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about $10 per day and manages to save about $3 each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Ang has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the loans, which have helped her to better support her children’s education. Now, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a decent motor for commuting. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is aged 50 years, and she is a widowed mother of seven children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Tbaug Khmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been struggling to feed her family by farming rice and cassava for 32 years. She is able to earn approximately 16,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 6,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.
 
Sok has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles, while the other member of Sok's Group is just with VisionFund this cycle. The past loans, which Sok fully repaid, have relieved her family’s burdens and improved their livelihood. Now Sok is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor to help her harvest her rice. Sok hopes to get a high crop yield from her cultivated land, so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for labor to help her with the rice harvest.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sembern

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district in Kampong Cham, Sembern is 52 years old and married with two children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on two hectares of farmland while her husband works as a carpenter to earn additional income for the family. They have been in these businesses for 19 years. The current business earns her family approximately 18,000KHR per day and manages them to save about 9,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first micro loan for Sembern with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD. With this loan, she is going to buy a scrape machine for her husband’s business and use a portion of it to spend on rice harvest labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for the family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a scrape machine for her husband’s business and to pay her rice workers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn is 58 years old and resides in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living, she has been engaged in rice farming. Her current business earns her approximately US$9 per day and allows her to save about US$3 each day after expenses. Sorn has been involved with VisionFund for thirteen years and has fully repaid her loans. She has successfully used her previous loans to support her family with enough food. She is now applying for a loan of US$800. With this loan, she is going to buy a decent motor for her family's commuting. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor for her family's commuting

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of Utamaduni group and is in her early 40s. She is single with three boys, two of whom are in school while one has finished already. She has been running a charcoal business for three years now.  She works from 7am to 6pm daily and she is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used previous loans to: buy a plot of land where she expects to start building her house, pay school fees and household expenses, make more bricks for her future house, and buy more charcoal.  Zainabu has paid back all her loans successfully. She requests this loan to increase her charcoal stock. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

This group loan will be shared between all 11 members of the Utamaduni Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her charcoal stock

loans.name: Buncheak's Group

texts.en: Buncheak, who is 27 years old, resides in a rural village of Ek Phnom district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is married and a mother of a daughter and a son, all of whom are under her responsibility and in school. To support her family, Buncheak raises pigs while her husband complements the income by farming rice, growing beans, and working as a hairdresser. Together, they are able to earn approximately 40,000 KHR daily and save around 14,000 KHR after deducting the daily expenses. Buncheak is leading a group of two female members who both are fourth-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Buncheak will spend some portion of the loan to support her husband's business by buying fertilizer, pesticide, and bean seeds. In hopes of expanding the pig-raising business and earning more income for the family, the other portion of the loan will be spent on buying more piglets to raise. After receiving her loan portion and effectively using it, she highly hopes that she can generate more income and use the income to improve the condition of her family as well as to advance her children’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and bean seeds

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her early 30s, is single with one daughter who goes to school. She has been running a Scania spare parts business for seven years now. She works from 7:30am to 6:00pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her stock of spare parts.

Her dream is to one day be able to own a big business selling different cars.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Wakulima," which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom, 47 years old, lives in the Dambae district located in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is married and has two children. Planting cassava, farming rice, and growing rubber are the businesses that form the main source of the family’s income. Each day, Sokhom and her husband are able to earn around 35,000 KHR. Sokhom, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who also is a first-time borrower to take out a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR each. The group representative, Sokhom, will spend her loan portion on buying fertilizer to support the family’s businesses. Sokhom’s only hope is to be able to make the family’s lifestyle better and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en: Youn is a citizen living in the Sangke district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is 42 years of age and married with four children, one of whom (a daughter) is under her responsibility and currently in school. To continually support her family, Youn plants corn, sugarcane, and lemongrass. Youn and her husband also work as paid workers in order to add more income to the family. Together, they are able to earn around 31,000 KHR daily. Youn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles already with which she has succeeded in making her family’s livelihood so much better and sending her children to school. Now, she is leading a female group member, who has been with VisionFund for five cycles, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. This hard-working woman, Youn, will use her requested loan portion to purchase sugarcane seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for the cost of labor. Via the help of her loan portion, Youn hopes that the current crops will have good quality and greater yields so that she can boost her income and use the income to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: To purchase sugarcane seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for the cost of labor

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
La señora Jessica para poder ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar hace 5 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa donde todos los días prepara en las mañanas el delicioso ceviche de pescado y por las noches vende fritadas (plato típico), todo esto acompañado de jugos, sodas u otras bebidas a preferencia de sus clientes. También con el crédito que recibe del banco ayuda a su esposo en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de pescado el mismo que vende recorriendo la ciudad.
   
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que gracias a las ganancias que le dejo el crédito anterior pudo comprar ciertas cosas que necesitaban sus hijos en la escuela, además uno de ellos se enfermo y tuvo que gastar en medicinas y es por esta razón que se atrasó en sus pagos pero luego con su trabajo pudo cancelar a tiempo. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado para que venda su marido y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Rosario" meets every fifteen days in Colorado, located in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are renowned both nationally and internationally. Most of the residents in this area engage in the manufacture of tagua buttons, handicrafts, and trade in general.

Señora Jessica lives here. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged  11, 9 and 6, who all go to school. Her husband is a trader.
 
Five years ago, Señora Jessica started a business to help her husband with household expenses. She has a small restaurant in her home. Every day, she prepares delicious fish ceviche in the morning and sells fried pork (a traditional dish) in the evening. All of her dishes are served with juices, sodas or other drinks preferred by her customers. Jessica also uses the loans she receives from the Communal Bank to help her husband with his business. He sells fish and travels around the city offering his products to people.
   
She is requesting another loan, because thanks to the profit she made from her previous loan she was able to buy certain items that her children needed for school. In addition, one of them became ill and she had to spend money on medicine, which is why she fell behind on her payments. However, with her work she was able to pay it off in time. She will use this loan to buy fish for her husband to sell and provisions for the dishes she prepares. She has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the assistance the loans have given her.  
 
Her goals are to move forward in her business and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy provisions and fish.

loans.name: Mwandege Mbagara Group

texts.en:
Haluwa is in her late twenties and is married with two children who go to school. For three years she has earned a living by running a cafe selling juices, sodas and food. She works from 5am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase drinks stocks and bought a TV to attract more customers to the cafe. She repaid her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her cafe stock and start building business premises. Her dream is to one day expand her business to other places.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwandege Mbagara," which has 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her cafe stock and start building business premises.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: A citizen living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district located in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province, Sophy, is 33 years of age and married. She has two daughters and a son, all of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. Sophy and her husband earn a living through farming rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland. Having been in the rice-growing business for 18 years, this couple is able to earn approximately 13,000 KHR per day and save around 8,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. This will be Sophy’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped her to strengthen the rice-growing business and improve the living standard of her family. In hopes of generating more income for the family, this time, Sophy is applying for a KHR 4,000,000 loan to buy cassava to sell. This hard-working woman (Sophy) expects a boost in the family's income via the help of the requested loan. She is also willing to use the anticipated income to improve the livelihood of her family and further advance her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his early 30s, is married. He has had a stationery business for two years. He works from 9am to 6pm daily, and he is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Peter will use his share of the loan to increase his stock of stationery items. His dream is to one day be able to open another, big business. 

Peter will share this loan with his borrowing group, Kondoa, which totals 12 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of stationery items for resale.

loans.name: Mariuxi Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariuxi, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es chofer.

Doña Mariuxi  es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días en las ventas que las realiza puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lo que es ropa empezó recién con el crédito anterior y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otras cosas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella cada día mejora su situación económica y su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un carro propio para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most residents here work making ‘tagua’ [ivory palm] buttons, crafts and in general commerce.

Mariuxi, 34, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has two children who are 17 and 13 years old; her youngest attends secondary school and her husband is a driver.  Mariuxi is a housewife who in order to earn her own income to help her husband with household expenses works selling clothes via catalogue and L’Bel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days selling door to door although most of her sales take place at home.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She’s been selling cosmetics for three years and recently started selling clothes with the previous loan; she’s doing very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfume, creams and cosmetics, among other things.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because thanks to the loans her economic situation and her business are better every day.  Her dream is to own a car so her husband can work.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive el señor Carlos, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer es ama de casa.
 
Don Carlos como muchas personas de esta localidad se  dedica a la fabricación de botones de tagua, para lo cual  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, ósea sin darles el acabado que requieren para ser comercializados, sus botones los vende a  comerciantes mayoristas que los  llevan a Manta y luego los envían al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su mujer, lleva en este negocio por más de 15 años, ya que aprendió desde muy joven esta profesión.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. 
Lleva casi dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most residents here work making ‘tagua’ [ivory palm] buttons, crafts and in general commerce.  Carlos, 33, lives here.  He’s in a free union and does not have children yet.  His wife’s a housewife.

Like many people in this community, Carlos works manufacturing ‘tagua’ buttons for which he owns a lathe (machine to cut tagua) used to manufacture the crude buttons; that is with none of the finishing touches they need in order to be sold.  He sells the buttons to wholesalers that take them to Manta to be exported abroad to be finished.  He works every day with his wife’s help and has been in this business 15 years having learned the profession while still very young.

He will use this loan to buy tagua which is the raw material for manufacturing the buttons.  He’s been in the communal bank almost two years and he likes it because of the help they give with the loans.  His dream is to own a house since he currently lives in his parents’.

loans.use: to buy ivory palm nuts.

loans.name: Manuela Idaelba

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí vive la señora Manuela, tiene 57 años  de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Manuela es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ganar algo y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar tiene una pequeña graja donde cría hasta 100 pollos por temporada, además de esto también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de harina de pescado. Trabaja todos los  días en ambas actividades, ella se desplaza a Manta para comprar el pescado que no se utilizan para fabricar el atún y luego lo traslada hasta su casa donde lo procesa para obtener la harina de pescado, la misma que luego entrega a comerciantes que la exportan al extranjero. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y le ha ido bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito por que gracias a las ganancias que le dejo el crédito anterior su marido pudo arreglar una parcela en la cual van a sembrar ya que se acerca la época invernal, para ella siempre los créditos son muy importantes ya que las ganancias siempre las invierte para mejorar su situación económica. Este crédito es para comprar comida para los pollos y pescado para elaborar la harina. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most residents here work making ‘tagua’ [ivory palm] buttons, crafts and in general commerce.  Manuela, 57, lives here.  She’s married and has five children who are all adults now; two of them still live at home. Her husband works in agriculture.

Manuela is a very good mother and wife who in order to earn something to help her husband with household expenses has a small farm where she raises up to 100 chickens per season.  In addition to this she also works making and selling fish meal.  She works every day at both businesses.  She heads to Manta to buy fish that’s not used in tuna production and she takes it home to be processed into fish meal which she sells to merchants that export it abroad.  She’s been in this activity for 8 years and has done well.

She is repeating her loan because thanks to profits from the previous one her husband was able to fix up a parcel of land they are going to plant on because winter is approaching.  For her, the loans are always very important because she always invests profits to improve her economic situation.  

This loan is to buy chicken feed and fish to make the fish meal.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help she gets from the loans to get ahead.  Her dream is to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish.

loans.name: Rosa Amparo

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 20, 13 y 12 años los cuales estudian en  Universidad y colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Rosa es una muy buena ama de casa que siempre ha estado al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar, ella realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de limón y de sandias en el ciclo del verano pero en el invierno ellos siembran maíz, arroz y maní ya que esos terrenos están cernamos al rio y se puede sembrar en toda época del año. Es gracias a la agricultura que pueden salir adelante además de dos familias que dependen de ellos ya que hay dos personas que trabajan con ellos a quienes les pagan un sueldo semanal por su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, insecticidas y fertilizantes para obtener una muy buena cosecha en este invierno. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Damas de Agua Fría” (Agua Fría Ladies) meets every two weeks in Ayacucho Parish in Santa Ana Canton, a place known for its beautiful fresh-water resorts that are a great tourist attraction in the canton and province.  Rosa, 42, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has three children who are 20, 13 and 12 years old and attending university and secondary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Rosa is a very good housewife who has always been conscious of her children’s and her home’s needs.  She’s taking out the loan so that her husband can use it in his work.  He works in agriculture growing lemons and watermelons in the summer but in winter they plant corn, rice and peanuts since their farmland is near a river and they can plant year-round.  It’s thanks to agriculture that they are able to get ahead and in addition so do two other families that depend on them because they have two employees that work with them and who earn a weekly salary for their work.

This loan is to buy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer to attain a good harvest this winter.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is that her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Guandugloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
Nabón es un cantón que esta ubicado al sudeste de la provincia del Azuay, una de sus características geográficas es la dispersión de su territorio, lo que impide un fácil acceso a las diferentes comunidades y dificulta la comunicación entre ellas, la actividad principal de sus habitantes es la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Guandugloma es un banco comunal que está conformado por 7 socias quienes son mujeres alegres, emprendedores que a pesar de la modernización aun mantienen viva su cultura, vestimenta y tradiciones, trabajan diariamente muy duro para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Ermita, este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Guandugloma. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 16, 10, 8, 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y tres estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora a diario como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María Ermerita trabaja diariamente muy arduo en la siembra y cosecha de sus terrenos, lo que cosecha utiliza para el consumo de su hogar y también las vende, cría animales como ovejas, gallinas, cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes, semillas y abono.

Su meta es tener un criadero más grande de animales.
texts.en:
Nabón is a parish located in the southeast of Azuay Province.  One of its geographical characteristics is its broken up territory which prevents easy access to some communities and makes communications between them difficult.  The main activity of its residents is agriculture and animal husbandry.  Many of them leave daily to jobs in the city.  “Guandugloma” is a communal bank with 7 members who are cheerful, enterprising women who despite modernization keep alive their culture, native costumes and traditions.  They work very hard every day to improve their economic stability and to move their families forward.

One of the members of this group is María Emerita.  This is her third cycle in Guandugloma communal bank.  She’s 34-years-old, married and has had five children who are 16, 10, 8, 5 and 2 years old.  Her oldest son attends secondary school and three of them attend a local elementary school.  Her husband works every day as a laborer and the house they live in is theirs.

María Emerita works very hard every day planting and harvesting on her land.  What she harvests is used for her home’s daily consumption and also is sold.  She raises animals like sheep, chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in her community.  She will use the money to buy chickens, guinea pigs, seeds and manure.   Her goal is to have a larger animal nursery.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Pacha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Paccha está conformado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por el cantón Nabon que se encuentra ubicado al sudeste de la provincia del Azuay, sus características geográficas es la dispersión de su territorio, lo que impide un fácil acceso a las diferentes comunidades y dificulta la comunicación entre ellas. Las socia se caracterizan por ser luchadoras, emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras que laboran en su mayoría en la agricultura o en la crianza de animales a los que los venden en la ciudad o en su propia comunidad, se enorgullecen de aun mantener viva su cultura, tradiciones y vestimentas tradicionales.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Aída, es una socia emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Paccha. Tiene 20 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora a diario como jornalero, aun no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Aida pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hijo que aun es pequeño, pero como tiene terrenos para cultivar siembra hortalizas y verduras las mismas que vende, también tiene animales como cuyes, gallinas y pollos.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, semillas y abono para continuar creciendo con su fuente de ingresos.
 
Su meta es agrandar la crianza de cuyes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Pacha is made up of 8 women members and one man. They live in the Nabon canton, which is located in the southeast of the Azuay province. One of it's geographic characteristics is the dispersion of its territory, which inhibits easy access among the various communities and makes communication difficult. The group members are characterized as hardworking, entrepreneurial, and as fighters. The majority of them work in farming or raising animals which they then sell in the city of in the own community. They are very proud that they have still kept their culture, traditions, and traditional dress alive. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Aída. She is an entrepreneurial members who wants to get her family ahead. This is the second loan she has had in the Pacha communal bank. She is 20 years old, married and within her marital relationship she has conceived one child who is now 2 years old. Her husband works daily as a day laborer. They still do not own their own home, which is why they rent. 

Aida spends most of her time at home caring for her child who is still little. However, since she has land to cultivate, she plants crops and vegetables, which she sells. She also has animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and chicks. 

She will use her new loan to buy chicks, seeds, and manure to continue increasing her source of income. Her goal is to expand the raising of guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy chicks, seeds, and manure.

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Sakun is a villager who resides in a rural village of the Dambae district, which is located in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 54 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Sakun works many jobs; she farms rice, plants cassava, and sells grocery items. This will be Sakun’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan helped her to secure food for her family and improve her family’s standard of living. This time, she is requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan to buy fertilizer to support her rice-growing business and cassava-planting business. Sakun would love to dedicate the efforts that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chantheoun's Group

texts.en: Chantheoun is 37 years old and married. She and her family live in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom (a son) is dependent on her. To earn a living, Chantheoun and her husband work as rice farmers and paid workers. Together, they are able to earn around 27,000 KHR daily. This is Chantheoun’s third time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she has obtained and successfully paid back have helped her to build a warm house in which her beloved family can live. Now to support the rice-growing business, Chantheoun is leading a loan group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 KHR in total. With 1,000,000 KHR, which is Chantheoun’s loan portion, she will utilize it to buy rice seed. This hard-working woman, Chantheoun, will use her requested loan portion very effectively in order to relieve her family’s burdens and move her family ahead.

loans.use: To  buy rice seed

loans.name: Maryuri Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 16 y 10, el mayor estudia en universidad dos  en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es obrero.
 
Doña Maryuri para generar sus propios ingresos y con estos solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos ya que su esposo no gana mucho  se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de pollo, ella trabaja todos los días ya que de lunes a viernes vende en su casa en un pequeño local que improvisa, pero los sabados y domingos ella pone un local en el mercado de Ayacucho ya que en esos días son los días de feria, ella  vende los pollos por libras y enteros, los pollos los compra en una granja de la localidad en la cual trabaja su esposo. Lleva más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y alimento para unos pollos que también esta criando en una pequeña granja que construyo. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el banco. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local comercial o un frigorífico.
texts.en:
The “Damas de Agua Fría” (Agua Fría Ladies) meets every two weeks in Ayacucho Parish in Santa Ana Canton, a place known for its beautiful fresh-water resorts that are a great tourist attraction in the canton and province.  Maryuri, 38, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has four children who are 20, 18, 16 and 10 years old.  Her oldest attends university, two are in secondary school and the youngest attends elementary school.  Her husband is a laborer.

To earn her own income to cover her children’s educational expenses since her husband does not earn very much, Maryuri works buying and selling chicken.  She works every day because from Monday through Friday she sells at home in a small, improvised space she sets up and on Saturdays and Sundays she sets up a stand in the Ayacucho market since those two days are market days there.  She sells the chickens whole and by the pound.  She buys them from a local farm that her husband works at.  She’s been doing this for more than 7 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy chickens and also feed for some chickens because she’s also raising some in a small farm she built.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help the bank provides.  Her dream is to have a great local business or a cold-storage unit.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive el señor Luis, tiene 24 años de edad, está casado pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposa actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su primer bebe, ella  es ama de casa.

Don Luis se dedica a la agricultura y los trabajos en el campo pero en la casa donde vive tiene una pequeña tienda, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.  Empezó con muy poco pero con el paso de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos él ha ido aumentando su negocio y en la actualidad tiene su tienda bien surtida, allí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa que es quien pasa la mayor parte del tiempo ya que él tiene que dedicarse a la agricultura, actualmente tiene el terreno listo para la llegada del invierno y va a sembrar maíz y maní. Lleva más de dos años con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, semillas e insecticidas para las siembras. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. 

Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y una tienda más grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
The “Damas de Agua Fría” (Agua Fría Ladies) meets every two weeks in Ayacucho Parish in Santa Ana Canton, a place known for its beautiful fresh-water resorts that are a great tourist attraction in the canton and province.  Luis, 24, lives here.  He’s married but does not have children yet.  His wife is actually six-months pregnant with their first baby; she’s a housewife.

Luis works in agriculture and doing work in the fields but also has a small store in the house where he lives.  He sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. there.  He started with very little but as days passed and with help from the loans he’s been gradually enlarging the business and he currently has a well-stocked store.  He works there with help from his wife who is the one that spends most of her time there since he has to work in agriculture.  His parcel is currently ready for the arrival of winter and he will be planting corn and peanuts.  He’s been in business more than two years and it makes it possible for him to get ahead.

He will use this loan to better stock his store.  He will buy basic staples as well as seeds and insecticides for the crops.  He’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes it for the help the institution provides.  His dream is to have his own house and a larger, better-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Many

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kror Kor province’s Pursat district, Many is aged 21 years and married. For more than five years, she has been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income to make a living. Her husband also earns extra income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 19,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Many is a new borrower with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a buffalo to raise, and will use a portion of it to spend on buying an oxcart to help her in the farming business. 

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo and an oxcart to help her in the farming business.

loans.name: Kimbeoun

texts.en:
Kimbeoun, age 52, is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is working while studying. She and her family live in a rural village of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia's Siem Reap province. Kimbeoun offers a decent life for her family by working as a rice farmer. 

This is Kimbeoun's first time requesting a USD 1,000 loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Kimbeoun will use one portion of her loan to improve her rice field, by purchasing fertilizer, and use the other portion of it to purchase a motorbike, which will make her children's transportation to school easier. This single mother (Kimbeoun) would love to dedicate all the efforts that she has put into her work, to support her children's education as far as possible. Kimbeoun expects a boost in the income generated by the rice-farming business after receiving the requested loan and using it as she plans.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice-growing land, and a motorbike for her children's transportation to school.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Saphorn is 29 years old and married. She has one son. The primary sources of her family’s income are sales of grocery items and rice farming and cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for wages. With 13 years of business experience, Saphorn can earn about 34,000 KHR per day, of which she manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day after paying her expenses. The main challenges for her family’s business are a drop in cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops. 

Saphorn has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used her first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burden. She plans to use the requested loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to improve the health of her rice and cassava crops in order to increase her family’s income, to better her living conditions, and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng, 54 years old, is a single father of five children. He has a son who is currently a student in the 10th grade. He and his family live in Siem Reap province's Kror Lanh district, Cambodia. Heng is a rice farmer on a four-hectare plot of farm. Having been in the current business for more than ten years, he is able to earn around 14,000 KHR daily and manages to save about 6,000 KHR for future needs. Heng, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a group member who also is a fourth-time borrower to take out a loan in the amount of 700,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. The past loans that Heng obtained and successfully paid back have helped him to better support his rice-growing business and secure food for his beloved family. This time, he will use his requested loan portion to purchase fertilizer to help keep his rice-growing business in good shape. Via the help of his requested loan portion, this hard-working father greatly hopes that he will receive a good-quality crop so that he can boost his income and use it to advance his children's schooling and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Meysom's Group

texts.en:
Meysom, 37, is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district, Pursat province. She is the mother of one son, who is dependent and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and fishing, which she has been doing for several years. Her husband helps the family to earn additional income, by selling fish and working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. 

Meysom’s group is comprised of four female members, who have been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. Meysom completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her businesses. Now she is leading her group to request another loan of 1,400,000 KHR, each person. She wants to use her portion of this loan to buy fishing nets for her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish and to sell them for a good price, to better her family’s living conditions and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her fishing business

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Prusat province, Sokhoern is a 33-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Farming rice and making palm juice have been the main sources of her family’s income for the past 10 years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day, of which she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses.

Sokhoern’s group consists of two members who live in the same area. The leader of her group, Sokhoern is going to use her portion to buy an oxcart to help in her farming business. She hopes to get a high yield from the rice paddy in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy an oxcart to help in her farming business

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 62, is a villager residing in a rural area of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia's Siem Reap province. She is married and has been blessed with five children, two of whom (daughters) have their own employment. This industrious woman, Nga, makes her living from agriculture, that is, farming rice on two hectares of farmland. She earns approximately 5,500 KHR daily, and she can save only about 2,000 KHR, after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

The lack of food is the biggest challenge for Nga's family. Therefore, she is leading a loan group of two female members, both of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). They seek a loan in the amount of 750,000 KHR in total. Nga is planning to use her requested loan portion, which is 250,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer for her rice. After receiving and using her loan portion in this smart manner, Nga has high hopes that she will be able to boost her income, so that she can use it to overcome the lack of food and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Jonh's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of four children, Jonh is aged 48 years and lives in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Pursat province, Cambodia. To support her family, she has struggled to farm rice as the main source of the family’s income. To add more income, she also raises pigs in her local area. She has been doing these activities for ten years. Her current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Jonh has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, while the other group members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now they are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Jonh is going to use her portion of the loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom, 24, is married and lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. The main source of the family’s income is rice farming on four hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for one year to make a living. 

To earn additional income, she is working as a hairdresser in a local area. The current business earns her approximately 21,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for her farming business.  

This is Yom’s first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Yom will use her portion to buy materials for supporting her hairdressing business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean is a villager living in a rural area of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia’s Siem Reap province. She is 52 years of age and married. Lean has five children, one of whom (a daughter) is still her responsibility and currently in school. 

To continually support her family, Lean works as a rice farmer on an eight-hectare plot of farmland. Low crop yields due to destruction by insects is the main challenge for her rice-growing business. Now, Lean is requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan to purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. After receiving her loan, Lean expects a boost in her income as well as an improvement in her rice-growing business. This hard-working mother will use the anticipated income to keep her dependent daughter in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the land where she grows rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: No

texts.en: No, 33 years old, is a resident residing in a rural village of Kror Lanh district in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. No is married and has two dependent sons, one of whom is currently in school. She earns the living through selling fruit, and her husband works as a rice farmer to complement their income. Together, they earn approximately 25,000 KHR per day and save about 13,000 KHR for future needs. No is requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner) in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR for the first time. She will use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer to support her husband's rice-growing business and use the remaining portion of the loan to buy more fruit to sell. No expects a boost in the family's income after receiving and effectively using the requested loan. She also is willing to use the anticipated income to meet the food needs for her family and, most importantly, support her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to buy more fruit to sell

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte has lived below the poverty level for years despite her efforts. Things took a better turn when she started running her livestock herding about eight years back.
Since then, she has been selling milk and other dairy products to locals. Albanians consume lots of dairy products, thus, the need for dairy is always high especially in the northern regions where food products are scarce.  Bread and cheese is considered a staple amongst many poor Albanian families.
Marte is in need of a loan to buy another milk cow and she hopes that she will get some financial help from lenders. Being able to buy another cow would be her best gift these holidays, she said.
Marte is married and has four children and this would be her second loan within the same institution.

loans.use: To add another milk cow to her existing herd

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim, a hard-worker blacksmith, is 41 years old and lives in northeastern Albania. He is married and has three children: 13, 8 and 6 years old. 

Forging metal is the type of activity that he has been practicing for the past ten years and has proven to be profitable according to Kujtim. He has been able to establish a good and steady clientele throughout the years and is proud of this, because he is not the only person who offers such services, yet he has known how to differentiate himself from the others. Recently, Kujtim has been very busy and the space where he has been operating his activity seems too small, and he wants to expand the shop. This is the reason why Kujtim is requesting a loan, and he hopes that everything will go well and that he will receive some financial help from lenders.

loans.use: To expand his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena is a northern villager in her sixties who has eight children in total; none of them are currently in school. For almost eleven years now she has been raising livestock and is happy. “That’s the only thing I know how to do well,” Prena said. “I like the daily routine from morning till late evening; milking the cows, cleaning up the stable, feeding them, taking the milk to the local market; making cheese/ ricotta cheese and butter; all of these are organic.  And this is what keeps me strong and makes me do more,” she continued saying. 

Prena is requesting a third loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to repair a stable; the previous loans have been repaid in full. She remains positive that lenders will show their generosity by lending to her.

loans.use: To repair a stable

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe is in her early thirties and married with two children, who are eight and four years old. About seven years ago, Bardhe started her livestock business, and she’s been happy with it overall, both in terms of progress and profits. As the only financial provider for her family, she is able to make an income from this activity while she is a stay-at-home mom.

Bardhe is planning on expanding this profitable activity, and she needs to add one more milk cow of a good breed to her herd. A loan from Kiva will help her vision become reality. She is requesting a loan of 130,000 Albanian Lek. She remains in good spirits with the holidays approaching, hopeful that she will get financial help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add one more cow of a good breed to her existing herd

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province of Cambodia, Sas is a 58-year-old. She is married and has six children. 

Sas has been in rice farming on a three-hectare area of farmland for almost 20 years, while her husband catches fish to support the family. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sas is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to seek a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay labor fees for harvesting rice.

 She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy-rice, so as to sell it for a good price to better her living condition.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Somalen's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Kror Lanh district, Siem Reap province, Somalen is a 34-year-old mother of one son who is dependent and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice farming and grocery selling, which she and her husband have been in for ten years. With her current business, they can earn about KHR 24,000 per day, but they can save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses.

Somalen has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Somalen completely used the previous loan to better support her current business. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use this loan to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to grow rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve her standard of living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Verónica De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica forma parte del banco comunal Zhullin hace dos años y medio, es una socia muy alegre y participativa en su grupo, vive por la comunidad de Zhullin en la vecina ciudad de Azogues, donde se puede encontrar muchos sitios turísticos, artesanales, religiosos, culturales y ecológicos, con una variada y riquísima gastronomía, la Virgen de la Nube que es venerada por los fieles de todo el país y turistas. La ciudad tiene gran riqueza tradicional por sus viejas casas con balcones de madera tallada y por la Catedral ubicada en la Plaza Central, con su imponente fachada de piedra.

La Señora Verónica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela, también está muy contenta ya que se encuentra en su octavo mes de gestación y todo va muy bien por el momento, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es de propia.

Ella tiene una tienda desde hace 7 años donde vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir n la compra de productos de primera necesidad, útiles escolares y artículos de bazar.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Verónica has been part of the Zhullin communal bank for 2 1/2 years.  She is a very cheerful and participative member of her group. She lives in the community of Zhullin, in the neighboring city of Azogues. There one can find many tourist, handicraft, religious, cultural, and ecological sites, along with 
a varied and very delicious cuisine and the Virgin of the Cloud who is venerated by the faithful of the entire country.

The city has a great wealth of tradition, with its old houses with carved wooden balconies, and the Cathedral located in the Central Plaza, with its imposing stone façade.

Verónica is 29 years old, married, and has two children ages seven and three. Her eldest son goes to school,  and she is also very happy because she is in her eighth month of pregnancy, and everything is going very well at the moment. Her husband works as a employee of a private company, and the home where they live is their own.

She has had a store for seven years, where she sells basic household necessities, school supplies and stationery. She works from Sunday to Sunday and has no fixed hours.

She is going to use the money from her new loan to buy basic household products, school supplies and stationery. Her goal is to complete her home, as it still needs some finishing work.

loans.use: To buy basic household products, school supplies and stationery.

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
Moul is 60 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Siem Reap province’s Kror Lanh district. She is a rice farmer, and also supplements her income by raising pigs. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.

Moul has been a member of VisionFund for five loan cycles already, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Moul fully repaid the past loans, which helped her to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR, each person. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed, for nourishing her pigs. She hopes to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price and better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, for nourishing and fattening her pigs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Para la Señora. Luz este es el séptimo crédito que realiza con sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Zhullin, es una socia muy cumplida en sus pagos y muy colaborativa, vive por la comunidad de Zhullin en la vecina ciudad de Azogues donde se puede encontrar muchos sitios turísticos, artesanales, religiosos, culturales y ecológicos, con una variada y riquísima gastronomía, la Virgen de la Nube que es venerada por los fieles de todo el país y turistas. La ciudad tiene gran riqueza tradicional por sus viejas casas con balcones de madera tallada y por la Catedral ubicada en la Plaza Central, con su imponente fachada de piedra.

Doña Luz es una mujer casada que tiene 30 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 11, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos asisten a una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora en su negocio propio ya que es un profesional en la panadería y pastelería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Luz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, para ayudar a su esposo economícamente se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar, en sus tiempos libres trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas  y alimento para animales.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
This is the seventh loan that Sra. Luz has received, along with her friends and fellow members of the Zhullin Communal Bank. She is a member who is very responsible with her payments and who collaborates with others. She lives in the community of Zhullin in the city of Azogues. The city has many tourist, handicraft, religious, cultural and ecological sites. There is also a varied and delicious cuisine, and the Virgen de la Nube, who is venerated by the faithful throughout the country, as well as by tourists. Azogues has a rich tradition displayed in it old houses with carved wooden balconies and in the Cathedral with its imposing stone facade, located in the Central Plaza,.

Doña Luz is a woman who is 30 years old and married. She has conceived four children in her marriage. They are 11, 7, 4 and 2 years of age. Her first three children attend a school in the city. Her husband has his own business and runs a bakery. They do not own a house and rent one.

Sra. Luz does household chores and cares for her children, who are still small. To help her husband financially, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also farms, but her crops are all for household consumption. In her spare time she helps her husband in the bakery.

She will use the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and to buy feed for the animals.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, 36 years old, is a villager from a rural area of the Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. To support her family, Sor has been involved in rice farming on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland. She supplements the income by raising pigs. Having engaged in this business for 10 years, she can earn about 13,000 KHR per day, and she can manage to save about 4,000 KHR, after offsetting daily living expenses. 

Sor is a new borrower with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three, to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor to help her harvest her rice. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully, so as to sell it for a good price. This will enable her to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to help her harvest rice.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is an experienced seamstress, particularly with northern traditional Albanian clothing and has been operating from her own home performing repair and alteration services for over 25 years. She is the only one in almost the entire region running such activity and the clientele is steady.

Liza is in her fifties and has two children; one of them is still attending a public university. 

Liza is in need for a loan of approximately 1,850 US dollars to purchase fabric and knitted material. Being aware that her profile will be published on Kiva for financial support from lenders, she would like to thank all of the lenders in advance for their generosity and wish them Happy Holidays.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and knitted material for her home based repairing & alterations services

loans.name: Cruz  Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora. Cruz es una socia alegre y carismática que conforma el banco comunal Zhullin, vive por el sector de Tomebamba en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, está situado en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su Centro Histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.
 
La Señora Cruz tiene 50 años es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados, dos viven  independientes y  uno vive aun en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo  un taxi, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Cruz inicio su negocio con su primer crédito que recibió, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un local propio que tiene en un mercado de la ciudad, también elabora y vende gelatinas actividad que le gusta mucho y en este negocio se encuentra hace 23 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Su crédito es para comprar ropa y tarinas de plástico para su gelatina.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio de ropa y tener más variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cruz is a cheerful and charming member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in the Tomebamba area of the the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the province of Azuay, located in the southern part of Ecuador's Andean cordillera. Its historical center was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, in the year 1999.
 
Cruz is 50 years old, married and has three adult children who are adults and married. Two live independently, and one still lives in their home and shares the household expenses. Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a taxi. The house where they live is rented.

Cruz started her business with the first loan she received. She sells clothing at her own shop that she has in the city's market. She also makes and sells jellies; work that she likes very much, and she has been in this business for 23 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed hours.

Her loan is to buy clothing and plastic cups for her jellies.
