Nancy is a hardworking woman who always liked working to help her husband get ahead and provide a good education for their children.  She started her food business several years ago, and over time improved it until she had a great restaurant.  She prepares her delicious dishes that she sells from her stand and for parties and social gatherings.  She works with eight people who receive a monthly salary.  She has had this business for more than 22 years and this is why she has many orders and customers who visit her restaurant each day to have her quality dishes.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foods to prepare her dishes.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and is the group’s president.  She likes it because of the quick loans and help.

Her goal is to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, solo el menor aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora que le encanta valerse por sí misma y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo poder ayudar a su marido que no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella se dedica a preparar bollos los m ismos que una vez que los prepara su esposo lleva a entregar a diferentes ciudades como Manta y Portoviejo aunque también vende en su casa lugar hasta el cual llegan muchas personas a servirse de este delicioso plato muy típico de nuestra provincia y que es de mucho agrados de sus clientes, omprargracias a esto su familia ha podido salir adelante ya que hay ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo y así no puede llevar los alimentos al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar maní ya que en la época de invierno escasea y se pone muy caro. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su familia tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as El Cady in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people here are farmers.

Rosa lives here.  She is 54 years old, married, and has seven adult children on their own.  Only the youngest one still lives at home.  Her husband is a farmer.  

Rosa is a woman who puts forth great effort and loves to value herself by the effort she puts into her work to help her husband, who does not earn much through his field tasks.  She makes “bollo” that her husband delivers to different cities like Manta and Portoviejo.  She also sells out of her home, where many people go to sample this delicious, and very typical dish in our province.  This has helped her family get ahead, as there are times when her husband doesn’t have work and can’t feed the family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy “mani,” now that the winter is coming and it gets expensive.  This will be her second cycle with the communal bank and she likes the loans that help her very much in her business.  Her dreams are to get ahead and that her family remains in good health.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Vicuñitas 2010 Chacaltaya Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VICUÑITAS 2010 CHACALTAYA está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis  mujeres y tres  varones, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Josefa tiene 35 años y tiene cinco hijos de la edades de 16, 12, 10, 8  y 4 años, la Sra. Josefa  es de ocupación carpintera trabaja junto a su esposo quien también es carpintero y quien le enseño este oficio tiene su propio taller ubicado en la zona de Zenkata,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera al por mayor ya que tiene que realizar entregas de muebles  la Sra. Josefa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que ella está orgullosa de trabajar ya que este oficio generalmente es de varones y ella salió adelante y se siente feliz porque traspaso estas barreras que lo logro a base de mucha perseverancia.
texts.en:
The VICUÑITAS 2010 CHACALTAYA entrepreneurial bank is made up of nine members; six women and three men.  All have different businesses.  Josefa is the president of the bank and she is 35 years old and has five children, ages 16, 12, 10, 8, and 4. She is a carpenter and works with her husband who is also a carpenter and who taught her this trade.  She has her own business in the Zenkata zone and will use the money from this loan to buy lumber in quantity so that she can fill some orders for furniture.

Josefa is a hardworking woman who is very grateful for the support from the institution and is proud to be able to work in this trade that is normally a man’s trade.  She has gotten ahead and is happy to have broken these barriers with her perseverance.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive el señor Juan, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace muy poco y aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer es ama de casa.

Él  se gana la vida trabajando como albañil, pero no siempre hay trabajo y en ocasiones a estado hasta un mes sin trabajo razón por lo cual decidió también dedicarse al comercio, con el crédito anterior que recibió del banco empezó con un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, esto lo realiza puerta a puerta cuando está desocupado de su otro trabajo, trabaja todos los días o si no los fines de semana ya que aprovecha para ir a otras ciudades a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito, gracias a esto cuando no tiene trabajo puede llevar el pan a su hogar.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque gracias al crédito anterior empezó su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady, in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every fifteen days. In this locality, the majority of the people work in agriculture.

In this place lives Juan. He is 25 years old and has a very recent common-law marriage, and has no children yet. His partner is a homemaker.

He earns his living working as a mason, but there is not always work, and on occasion he has been without work for a month. Because of this, he decided to also work as a storekeeper. With the previous loan that he received from the bank, he started a business selling all types of clothing. He does this door-to-door when he is not busy from his other work. He works every day, or if not, on the weekends, as he takes the opportunity to go to other cities to offer the same products. Thanks to this, when he doesn’t have work, he is able to bring bread to his home. 

He is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. He has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and he likes it, because thanks to the previous loan, he began his business. 
  
His goal is to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Matilde Etelvina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de un año y tres meses la cual es su razón de vida, actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Doña Matilde para ganar algo propio y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y hace poco con el crédito anterior empezó con ventas de sandalias y zapatos de niños, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos a tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya que también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, por lo general lo que más vende son prendas de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Matilde lives here.  She is 34 years old, married, and has a one year old daughter.  Her husband is a security guard.

Matilde, in order to earn an income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells all types of clothing.  She recently used the money from a previous loan to start selling children’s sandals and shoes around the city, two days a week.  She also sells from her home, where her best customers visit her.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to and has been doing this for seven years.  Things have gone well for her.  Most of her sales are women’s clothing.

She will use the money from this loan to buy items such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  This will be her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she improves her business more with each loan.

She hopes to be able to fix up her home with all the comforts.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Flor Leida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive la señora flor, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos de 12, 10, 9  y  dos que son gemelos de 7 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz y trabaja en un taller.
 
Doña Flor  es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos mprase dedica a  preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas, cueritos, corviches, jugos, batidos de frutas y sodas, entre otras cosas, ella espera recibir este crédito porque lo quiere invertir en adecuar un local más grande y comprar ciertos utensilios de cocina para empezar a vender comida por las tardes y con esto poder obtener más ganancias por el bien de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.
  
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar utensilios de cocina y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Flor lives here.  She is 32 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has five children, ages 12, 10, 9 and a set of 7 year old twins.  Her husband is an automotive mechanic and works in a workshop.

Flor is a good housewife who prepares and sells snacks in order to help out with the household expenses and her children’s education.  She makes empanadas, pork rinds, corciches, juices, fruit smoothies, and sodas among other things.  She hopes to receive this loan so that she can buy certain kitchen utensils and ingredients to prepare her food in the evening and to increase her profit.  The wellbeing of her children is the most important thing to her.

She has had three cycles with the communal bank and likes it because of the loans she gets.  Her dreams are to have a grand restaurant and for her children never to be in need of anything.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Khan, aged 49 years, is a citizen residing in Ek Phnom district located in the Battambang province of Cambodia. She is divorced with eight children, some of whom are currently in school and some have their own employment. 

Khan makes her living through raising ducks and selling fish. Khan, a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member named Kimsun, who also is a third-time borrower, to take out loans in the amounts of 1,400,000KHR and 1,000,000KHR respectively. With the requested loan portion, Khan will spend a portion of it buying poultry feeds and more ducklings to raise. The other portion of the loan will be spent buying more fish to sell. She believes that she will be able to generate more income for her family. Khan is also willing to use the anticipated income to keep her children in school and make the family’s living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and more ducklings to raise.

loans.name: Reouy's Group

texts.en:
Reouy is a 51-year-old villager who resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district located in Battambang province, Cambodia.  She is married and the mother of four children, one of whom (a daughter) is dependent on her and still attends school. 

Reouy farms rice on a three-hectare plot of land while her husband works as a paid worker.  Together, they are able to earn around 14,000 KHR daily and to save approximately 5,000 KHR after accounting for the daily cost of living.  This will be Reouy’s eighth time requesting a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The previous loans have helped her improve her family’s living standards.  

Now, she is leading a loan group comprised of four female members in order to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the group representative, Reouy, will use her loan portion to support her rice-growing business by purchasing fertilizer.  After receiving and using the loan as she plans, Reouy believes that her rice field will provide her with a good-quality crop so that she can sell it at a good price, generating more income to the family.  She will also use the income to keep her dependent child in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district, located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Sareoun is divorced. She is 43 years old and has one child. 

To offer a decent life for her family, Sareoun works as a rice farmer and factory worker. Each day, she is able to earn around 13,000 Cambodia riels (KHR) and manages to save about 6,000 KHR after deducting the cost of living.

Sareoun is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR with VisionFund, a Kiva partner, for the first time. She plans on using a portion of this loan to buy fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. The other portion of the loan will be spent on finishing building her house.

This single mother expects a boost in her income after receiving the requested loan so that she can use the income to relieve her family’s burden as well as secure the family’s finances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en: Sreymao is a citizen living in a rural village of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is 26 years of age and married with one chile who is too young for schooling. To make a living, Sreymao works as a weaver and rice farmer. To increase her family's income, she also has a pig-raising business. Sreymao is able to earn KHR28,000 per day. This is Sreymao’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a KHR4,000,000 loan to buy a cow to help in her rice-growing business. She believes that, after receiving the loan and using it in a smart manner, she can earn more income from her rice-growing business. She is willing to use the income to move her family ahead and send her child to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
Rong is 52 years old and married, and she resides in a rural village of Moung Russey district, in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is blessed with three children, one of whom (a son) is employed as a paid worker. To earn a living for her family, Rong has been growing rice and raising pigs, tirelessly, for more than 20 years. She earns around 34,000 KHR daily and saves approximately 6,700 KHR, after deducting the daily living expenses. 

Now Rong is in need of money to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pig feed. Thus, Rong is leading a group member, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR, each. With the help of her part of the requested loan, this hard-working woman (Rong) believes that she can earn more income for the family and improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pig feed

loans.name: Orm's Group

texts.en:
Orm resides in Sangke district in Cambodia’s Battambang Province. She is a 46-year-old widow with eight children, two (a daughter and a son) of whom are under her responsibility and currently in school. 

Orm farms rice and raises pigs and cows in order to make a living. She is leading a loan group of three female members, all of whom have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loan cycles already. Orm, as a group representative, mentions that the previous loans have enabled her to secure the family’s finances and food needs. 

This time, Orm is leading her group to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As group leader, Orm will utilize her loan portion to buy fertilizer, feed for her animals (pigs and cows), and to pay wages to farm laborers to transplant her rice field. 

She has a dream of expanding her business and generating more income for the family. Orm is also willing to use the anticipated income to support her school-aged children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed for her animals (pigs and cows), and to pay wages to farm laborers to transplant her rice field.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Ny is a villager living in a rural village in Kror Kor district, located in Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with a son who is still dependent on her and too young for schooling. Ny and her husband work as rice farmers in order to make a living. To add more income to the family, Ny also has a business making palm juice. This couple is able to earn 28,000KHR per day and saves approximately 18,000KHR after deducting their daily expenses. 

Ny, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member, who is a third-time borrower, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,800,000KHR in total. As group leader, Ny will use her loan portion, which is 1,000,000KHR, to purchase spare parts for her tractor. She would like to dedicate all of her hard work to moving her family ahead and hopefully send her only son to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her tractor

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a citizen living in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is 30 years old and married with three dependent children. Two of her children are school-aged and the other one is too young for schooling.

Mao and her husband have been working as rice farmers on a two-hectare farmland, earning around 22,000KHR daily. Mao has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already, with which she accomplished relieving the burdens of her family. Now she is leading a loan group of two female members to seek for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000KHR in total. With 1,000,000KHR, which is Mao’s requested loan portion, she will purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. Mao has a dream of being able to expand her rice-growing business by buying more plots of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es maestro constructor.

Doña Lucia es una mujer muy luchadora que al ver que a su esposo en ocasiones no tiene trabajo ni como llevar el pan diario a su hogar decidió hace 11 años empezar con un negocio en su casa, ella con lo que tenia surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres la misma que con el paso del tiempo ha ido surtiendo poco a poco hasta tenerla como lo tiene en la actualidad, en su local sus clientes encuentran de todo desde víveres hasta productos de bazar y papelería y también hace recargas telefónicas, ella está muy feliz ya que así ella contribuye con gran parte en los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres, productos de bazar y recargas telefónicas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se le hace más fácil financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener un bebé.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady in the Colon district of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the "La Cantera" communal bank meet every two weeks. In this area, most people work in agriculture.

Lucia lives in El Cady. She is 38 years old and married, but does not have children yet. Her husband is a general contractor. 

Lucia is a very determined woman who, after seeing her husband out of work at times with no way to earn money, decided to start a business in their house 11 years ago. She stocked a small food store with what she had on hand. As time went by, she added products little by little until it became what it is today. In her shop, her customers find everything, from groceries to household goods to paper products, as well as prepaid phone cards. She is very happy since this is how she contributes significantly to their household expenses.

This loan is to buy groceries, miscellaneous household goods, and prepaid phone cards. She has been in her communal bank for four cycles and she likes it because the loans make it easier to finance her business.

Her dream is to someday have a baby.

loans.use: to buy groceries, miscellaneous household products, paper goods, and prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en: Rem is 22 years old and resides in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. She is married and a mother of two daughters, both of whom are under her responsibility and too young for schooling. To offer a decent life for the family, Rem has been farming rice, planting beans, and sesame for five years. Rem’s husband also assists in the family’s business and works one more job, which is a paid worker, to complement the family’s income. Each day, this hard-working couple is able to earn around 15,000KHR and save about 9,000KHR after canceling out the daily expenses. To help keep her business in good shape, Rem is leading a loan group of two female members who both are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. As a group leader, Rem will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the cost of labor. After receiving and wisely using her requested loan portion, Rem believes that she can strengthen her farming business, generating more income for the family. She is also willing to use the anticipated income to move her family ahead and send her beloved kids to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en:
A 42-year-old married woman named Kheoun is a villager living in the Thmor Koul district located in Cambodia’s Battambang Province. 

She is married and has nine children, some of whom are working as rice farmers and some who are working as paid workers. The main source of the family’s income comes from the rice-farming business. To supplement the income, Kheoun also works as a paid worker, while her husband works as a fisherman. 

This will be Kheoun’s fourth time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loans that she obtained and successfully repaid have had a huge positive impact on her, as well as her beloved family. Kheoun has been able to guarantee food needs in the family and keep her family’s rice-growing business in good shape. 

Now she is requesting a KHR 3,000,000 loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and to pay wages to farm laborers. 

Kheoun’s only hope is to be able to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Fátima Ximena

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 1 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

La señora Fátima es una mujer muy luchadora que con la intención de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, sobrecamas y edredones, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, da crédito y los cobros los realiza por semanas ya que esto le permite conseguir más clientes y sus ventas siempre mejoran, ella lleva más de 4 años en este negocio el cual le permite ayudara  su esposo el cual no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, sobrecamas y edredones, entre otras cosas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the sector known as El Cady, in the parish Colon, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of “Banco Comunal La Cantera” (Community Bank of Quarry) meet every fifteen days. In this area the majority of people work in agriculture. Fatima lives in this area. She is 27 years old and maintains a free union from which she has 4 children, They are 11, 9, 7 and 1 years old. The three eldest study in school. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Fatima is a hard working woman with the intention to help her husband with the costs of the home. She works in commerce selling sheets, bedspreads and comforters. She sells door to door by credit and charges by week because this allows her to get more clients and her sales always improve. She has been working in this business for more than 4 years which allows her to help her husband who does not make a lot of money in his field tasks. 

This loan will be used to purchase sheets, bedspreads, and comforters, among other things. She has done three cycles in the communal bank and she likes it for the help that she receives from the bank. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, bedspreads, and comforters, etc.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Sampov Meas District where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Phat is aged 30 years and married with six children, three of whom are dependent on him. He and his wife have struggled to feed their family by farming rice on one hectare of farmland for 20 years.  The current business earns him approximately 20,000 KHR per day.

Phat’s group consists of five members, and he is in his fifth micro loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He fully paid back the past loans, which have helped him better support his family. Now he is leading his group to request another loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice healthfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Pann's Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Pann resides in a rural village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three sons and a daughter, all of whom are currently in school. To make a living, she works as a rice farmer on a two-hectare plot of farmland, earning around 15,000KHR per day. 

Pann has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles already, with which she accomplished sending her children to school. Now she is leading a group of four female members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,600,000KHR in total. The group leader, Pann, will use some portion of her loan to harvest rice. The other portion of the loan will be spent on buying pigs to raise as a new business. She hopes to raise healthy and fat pigs. Via the help of this loan, she highly believes that she can increase her income and use the anticipated profits to further pursue her children’s educations.

loans.use: to harvest rice and buy pigs to start a new pig business

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Chreb is 38 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through growing rice and cassava. Having been in this business for twenty years, she manages to earn about 50,000KHR per day and can save about 15,000KHR each day for the future needs.
Chreb has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid the loan which helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood and also support her child’s education. Now she is seeking another loan of US$1,150. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her cassava and rice growing and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her cultivated land so as to sell them for a good price to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her cassava and rice growing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yer's Group

texts.en:
Yer resides in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She is 45 years of age and married with two children. Yer is a rice farmer on a three-hectare plot of farm. Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn around 10,000KHR per day and save approximately 5,000KHR after canceling out the daily costs of living. 

Yer, a first-time borrower, is leading another group member who is also a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. Yer will utilize her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor. After receiving the requested loan, Yer expects a boost in her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is 40 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Out of her five children, she has three children to take care of that are still in school. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice on a five-hectare area of farmland for 12 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 27,000KHR but she is able to save 10,000KHR each day.
This is the first loan for Heng’s group of two members. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor in harvesting rice. Heng hopes to get a high yield from her rice-paddy to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and spend on labor harvesting rice.

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Pok is 31 years old and married with five dependent children, one of whom is still in school. She lives in a rural village in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district. She earns a living through rice farming. 

Pok’s group is comprised of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Together they can earn about KHR13,000 per day from their current business and can save about KHR3,000 each day for the future needs. Pok fully paid back the past loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group by asking for another loan from VisionFund of KHR1,200,000 per group member. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs for rice harvesting and use a portion of it to buy piglets to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes to earn more income from her current business in order to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor for rice harvesting.

loans.name: Ngem's Group

texts.en:
Ngem, aged 57, is living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district and has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. He and his wife are farmers in the area to make a living. He has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Ngem has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, while the other member has been with VisionFund for six cycles. He has successfully used the previous loan to better support his family's living conditions. 

Now he is leading his group to apply for another loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to spend on labor costs for harvesting rice. Ngem hopes to earn more income from his rice paddy so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To spend on labor costs for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
Hing, 42, is married with eight children residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Three of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband has been weaving a mats. Together, they can earn about KHR40, 000 per day to meet the family needs.
Hing has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other members are with VisionFund for the first time. Hing completely paid back the previous loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family with enough food. She and her group members are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy materials for her weaving business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sarem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Sarem is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for five years, she is able to earn about KHR 5,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 2,500 each day for future needs.  

Sarem is a third-cycle client with VisionFund, and she completely paid back the past two loans. She smartly used the loans to make her living gradually improve. 

Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Sarem, who is the leader, will use her portion to spend on labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high crop yield so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
A resident of a rural area in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Savoen, 49, has six children in total. Four of them are staying with the family, and some of them are still in school. Savoen and her husband are farmers, who have been growing various kinds of vegetables, such as garlic, salad greens, and cucumber, for 20 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.

Savoen has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan. The past loan helped her to better support her children’s education. Now she is requesting another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land. Through this loan, she hopes to earn more income from the farming business, so as to improve her family’s lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Siem Reap Province’s Srey Snom District, Chreb is aged 37 years and married with four children, who are still in school. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 10,000 per day, and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for future needs.

This is the first group loan for Chreb with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is a villager residing in a rural village of Srey Snom District located in Cambodia’s Siem Reap Province. She is a 60-year-old widow with five children, two of whom  (a daughter and a son) are dependent on her and still in school. 

Heang makes her living out of agriculture, i.e. farming rice. Having been involved in the current business for more than 35 years, she is able to earn around 20,000 KHR per day.  

Heang has already been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three loan cycles, with which she succeeded in increasing her productivity. Now, she is leading a loan group of four female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 4,800,000 KHR in total. 

As a group representative, Heang will use some of her requested loan portion of this loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. The other portion of the loan will be spent on running a new business, which is buying piglets to raise. Via the help of her loan portion, Heang believes that she will be able to secure food needs for her family and keep her beloved children in school as long as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and run a piglet raising business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom, 51, lives with her husband and six children in a village of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. Of all of her children, she still has one child dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for ten years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. 

Khom’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Khom fully paid back the past loans, which have helped her improve her living condition. She is now leading her group to apply for another loan. 

As the leader, Khom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on harvesting the rice. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to spend on harvesting the rice.

loans.name: Yeout's Group

texts.en:
Yeout, 52 years old, lives in a rural area of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia’s Siem Reap province. She is the mother of eight children, all of whom have their own employment. 

To support the family, Yeout works as a rice farmer while her husband works as a paid worker. This hard-working couple can earn around 14,000 KHR daily. 

Yeout is leading Yeout's Group, a group of two female members (including Yeout), both of whom are third-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They seek a combined loan in the amount of 1,800,000 KHR. The group leader states that, with the help of the previous loans, she has been able to better support her family. 

This time, Yeout is using her loan portion to harvest rice and to buy two piglets to raise. This is a new business for her. With this loan, she hopes to harvest her rice on time and successfully operate her new, pig-raising business.

loans.use: To harvest rice and to buy two piglets to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children, in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. The children are dependent on him and still in school.

He has a threshing machine for rent to others, for a fee, during harvesting season. This is the first loan for Nga with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is requesting a loan of US$700 to buy gasoline and spare parts for his threshing machine. He hopes to earn more income from his current business, so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for his threshing machine.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet resides in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province in Cambodia. She is 31 years old and married with one daughter.  

To support the family, Yet and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years. They supplement their income by working for others for a fee. Their business earns the family about 6,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Yet’s group consists of three members, all of whom live in the same village. This is her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, Vision Fund. She is leading her group in a request for a loan of 500,000 KHR each.

Yet is going to use her portion to pay labour costs for harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay labour costs for harvesting rice

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en:
A villager residing in a rural village of Sa Ang district located in Cambodia’s Kandal province, Yeoun is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are students. To support the family, she works as a rice farmer while her husband plants cucumbers and catches fish. 

This will be Yeoun’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a USD 1,000 loan. Yeoun will use a portion of her loan to support her rice field by buying fertilizer, pesticides, and to cover the cost of labor. The other portion of the loan will be spent on purchasing a machine for her husband’s fishing boat to support his fish-catching business. After receiving and using the requested loan in a smart manner, Yeoun expects a boost in the family’s income and to use the income to relieve the family’s burden and further pursue her children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to cover the cost of labor on her rice farm

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucy ella es conviviente y tiene 25 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 2 años y el está yendo bien, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, anteriormente la socia trabajaba en su grifo pero no el fue my bien porque le pagaban muy poco, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender  los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y chanchos y alimentos para los animales.
Los socios qu estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto, porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganado, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de servicio de taxi y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Warmicuna Llanoqanchis” communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province and Cusco Department.  Lucy, 25, has a spouse and a son.  She works in her business raising animals; she raises guinea pigs and pigs.  She fattens them up and when they grow she sells them in various street markets.  She works from 8am until 4pm and has been in business two years.  She’s doing well and is able to support her son by means of this business.  She used to work in a gas station but didn’t do too well because she was paid very little.  Her dream is to have a place to sell her animals.  She’s requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and feed for them.  She is grateful to those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The members who appear in the inserted photo took their photo after the group photo because they asked permission due to work.  The other group members work selling livestock, beauty products, providing taxi service and work selling food.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Felix Alvaro

texts.es: EL Señor Félix, es un Hombre ejemplar, de una comunidad del departamento de león, es casado con una hija la que goza de todo el apoyo para su desarrollo académico, este señor es comerciante y pequeño productor, su actividad económica más importante es la pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, la que con muchos esfuerzos y con pequeños financiamientos ha logrado el nivel que hoy tiene, este señor solicita a  ceprodel un financiamiento para incrementar su inventario y lograr la oportunidad de negocio como es en estas fiestas navideñas, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la compra de lo más básico  como es frijoles, arroz, aceite azúcar, semolina, arina jabon etc; Ya que también le viene a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Félix is an exemplary man from a community in León Department.  He’s married and has a daughter whose academic development he fully supports.  He’s a merchant and small producer.  His most important economic activity is a home-based grocery store that has reached the level it has to date thanks to much effort and small loans.  He is asking Ceprodel for a loan to increase inventory and take advantage of the business opportunity the Christmas season represents.  He will buy the most basic things like beans, rice, oil, sugar, semolina, flour, soap, etc. since it’s also useful to improve his living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida Rosa vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una joven de 35 años, soltera, con 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar. Gracias a su profesión como profesora de primaria que ha desempeñado por 7 años ha mantenido y ha podido darle lo mejor que puede a sus hijos sin la ayuda del padre de ellos y ha mejorado su vivienda hasta donde ha podido bajo sus posibilidades.

También hace muchos años adquirió un terreno en un barrio de dicho municipio donde empezó a construir su propia casita con la ayuda de los créditos y su salario, ya que alquilaba locales para vivir, hoy ya cuenta con su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando conforme pasan los años.

Está solicitando un crédito para terminar de construir un cuarto para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y mano de obra, con el fin de brindarles mayor espacio a sus pequeños hijos.

espera que  KIVA y Ceprodel  financien este crédito que ayudara a cumplir sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa lives in El Sauce located in west León Department.  She’s 35-years-old, single and has three school-age children.  Thanks to her profession as an elementary school teacher that she’s been in for seven years, she’s been able to provide the best for her children and has been making home improvements to the best of her ability.

She also bought a piece of land some time ago in town where she’s started to build her own house with help from loans and with her salary.  She used to rent places to live and today she has a house of her own that she’s been improving as years have passed.

She’s requesting this loan to finish building a room.  She will buy bricks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and pay labor costs to provide more space for her little children.  She hopes that KIVA and Ceprodel will finance this loan that will help her reach her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Yervacio

texts.es: El Sr. Yervacio sigue con su actividad de transporte, pero ahora de transporte pesado ya que se encarga de trasladar material de construcción a distintas obras de la ciudad de La Paz, y cuando puede sigue ayudando a su esposo en su trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su camión ya que las que tienen ya están muy gastadas y tiene un poco de temor ya que con la carga que lleva se pueda  pincharlas llantas  por el peso.
texts.en:
Yervacio continues to make a living in transport, but he now works with heavy transport, taking construction materials to different building sites around La Paz. He also still helps his wife with her work when he can. 

This time, he is requesting a loan to buy new tires for his truck, because the ones he is using at the moment are very worn and he is worried that a tire may burst under the weight of the load he carries.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora francisca es una Madre abnegada de un poblado del municipio del Departamento de león, es madre soltera, con un hijo al que le brinda todo el apoyo, trabaja en un centro de salud de la comunidad donde habita con 25 años de laborar.

 por su bajo nivel académico ya que no pudo estudiar por ser de bajos recursos, el cargo que desempeña es de conserje, el cual lo ejerce dignamente, con esas condiciones socio económicas ella ha venido mejorando su vivienda, pero también necesita de una mano amiga para efectuarlos en menos tiempo, por solicita a ceprodel un financiamiento y emprender su sueño. esta señora merece el apoyo ya que es una mujer responsable en sus actos.
texts.en: Francisca is a self-sacrificing mother from a town in León Department.  She’s a single mother of a son who she fully supports.  She has worked in a local health center for 25 years.  Because of her low academic level due to the lack of resources for schooling, she’s been working as a caretaker, a job she does with dignity.  Even with those conditions, she’s been making home improvements but she needs a friendly hand in order to do them in less time which is why she’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to reach her dream.  She deserves support because she’s a woman who is responsible with what she does.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luz De Fátima

texts.es:
Doña Luz de Fátima  de 37 años que desde que se casó y formó su hogar se dedica al comercio donde su negocio consiste en un Cafetín ubicado en un colegio de secundaria donde ofrece comida rápida a los estudiantes y maestros.

Su día inicia a las 5 am para preparar los platillos que vende en el cafetín a las 10 am y a las 3 pm que es la hora de receso. 

Se dedica a este oficio desde hace 4 años el que le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.

Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de pollo, azúcar, frutas, arroz, plátanos, agua y jugos con el objetivo de brindarles mayor variedad de comida  a sus clientes.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a los pequeños comerciantes que necesitan de este capital para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Luz de Fátima is 37. Since she got married and started her household, she has been a businessperson. Her business is a small café located in a high school, where she offers fast food to students and teachers. 

Her day starts at 5:00am, so that she can prepare the dishes that she sells in the café at 10:00am and at 3:00pm, which is recess time.

She has worked in this occupation for four years, which has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses and provide better living conditions to her children.

She is applying for this loan to buy chicken, sugar, fruits, rice, plantains, water and juices, with the aim of offering a greater variety of food to her customers.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they offer to small businesses who need this working capital to keep going.

loans.use: To buy chicken, sugar, fruit, rice, plantains, water and juices.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.es:
El Sauce es un municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, en él habita Marianella, una joven de 33 años, casada, madre de un hijo, con muchos deseos de superación que estudió Programación digital con el fin de tener un mejor nivel social y por ende un mejor desarrollo económico, se desempeña como tal para una Institución privada donde tiene muchos años de trabajar.

Como toda joven con sueños para el futuro desea llegar a ser una excelente profesional, tener su propia vivienda y una familia estable.

Está solicitando un crédito para incurrir en gastos de la promoción de su hijo el cual se gradúa de primaria.

Está muy agradecida con KIVA y Ceprodel por este período que tiene de trabajar con ellos y que le han brindado su mano amiga con el apoyo de estos créditos que aseguran el futuro de las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a town belonging to León Department.  Marianella, 33, lives there.  She’s married and has a son and very much wants to make progress.  She studied digital programming aiming at attaining better social standard and thus improved economic development.  She has worked as such for a private firm for many years.  Like all young women with dreams future dreams, she wants to become an excellent professional, to own a house and have a stable family.

She’s requesting a loan to pay graduation costs for her son who is graduating from elementary school.  She’s very grateful to KIVA and Ceprodel for the time she’s been working with them and for the friendly hand they’ve extended to her with support from these loans that insure the future of people most in need.

loans.use: to pay for her son's elementary school graduation.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 25 años, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de El Tejar,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  un horno de mayor capacidad ya quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad por la zona y por este motivo el solicito el crédito ya que quiere mejorar su producción, con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, Juan es una persona joven  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que el tiene.
texts.en: Juan, 25, works baking bread.  His bakery is located in the El Tejar zone.  This is his first loan in the institution and Juan will use it to buy a larger capacity oven because he wants to increase production to meet customer demand.  The business challenge Juan faces is competition from a nearby bakery that produces in larger amounts and this is why he’s requesting the loan because he wants to improve production.  His profits will increase with this loan.  Juan is a young person who very much wants to get ahead.  He feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provide since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy an eight-can indurstrial oven.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young man living in Ica city, the capital of Ica Province. He is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents to help support his family. Day to day, he works from 10 to 12 hours as a mason. It is a very demanding job, but he dedicates himself to his profession so that he may better the life of his family. He believes his business has grown successfully because of the good quality work that he performs. Because of a lack of resources, Juan Carlos was only able to finish school up to the 5th grade. However, he would have liked to study agronomy had he the opportunity. Ica has a large agricultural industry.

He will use this Kiva loan to purchase items to sell during the Christmas season. This extra income will give Juan Carlos and his family a better quality of life.Juan Carlos thanks his Kiva lenders for allowing him to bolster his business while preparing to have a business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell duirng the Christmas season.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes  ella es separada ,tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria por su casa, la socia lleva un año en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez trabaja en el restaurante de su mama atendiendo a los clientes que van al restaurante, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio de anticuchos como carne, aceite, carbón entre otros.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de refrigerios, restaurante, venta de hamburguesas, maestro constructor, agrónomo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Communal Bank "Virgen Del Carmen". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

One group member is Mercedes. She is separated, 31 years old, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling meat skewers, which she sells out of her house. Mercedes has been in this business for one year and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her business each day. She also works in her mother's restaurant, serving guests that go to the restaurant. Mercedes is a responsible and hard-working person and it is in this way that she moves her family forward. 
 
Mercedes is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her meat skewer business, including meat, oil, charcoal, and more. 

Other group members make a living in different businesses, including selling light lunches, running a restaurant, selling hamburgers, general contracting, and agriculture. 

Mercedes is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and agrees to comply with the payment of her quotas in the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her meat skewer business such as meat, oil, charcoal, and more.

loans.name: Basislio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Basislio Antonio esta casado, tiene 54 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica a la carpintería, a la fabricación de muebles, roperos, pertas, ventanas y entre otros, inicio este trabajo siendo operario y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que los utilizara para la compra de madera: tablas, reglas, pintura, etc, esto para mejorar su producción de muebles, ya que espera en el futuro, quiere tener un negocio grande y con muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Basilio Antonio is married. He is 54 years old. He studied through the 4 years of primary school. He has 7 children, of whom 2 are studying. He works in carpentry. He makes furniture, wardrobes, doors, and windows, among other things. He started out in this line of work as a worker and he now has 15 years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who works as a homemaker.

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy wood, boards, rulers, paint, etc. This will improve his furniture production. In the future, he hopes to have a large business with many clients.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Mercedes Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes, tiene 65 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan y repostería, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, en la zona de Barrio Municipal, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, Sra. Mercedes va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que quiere hacer terminar de construir un cuarto en su casa y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia Sra. Mercedes. es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad ya que le ayuda a crecer en su negocio como también en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mercedes, 65, works baking bread and pastries; her bakery is located at home in the Barrio Municipal zone.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Mercedes will use it to build a room at home to provide more family comfort.  Mercedes is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity being provided because it helps her business grow and also to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita es una señora convencida de que los productos naturales que ella ofrece son eficientes para curar varias enfermedades, ella misma los ha probado y la ayudó a combatir muchas deficiencias en su salud. Quiere compartir y ofrecer a muchas personas la oportunidad de usarlos para beneficiar su salud. Ya hace algún tiempo viene desarrollando el proyecto de vender estos productos en un local fijo para ello necesita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000)con esto comprará más productos y acondicionará el lugar donde brindará este servicio.

Manifiesta estar feliz de haber encontrado apoyo financiero ágil y rápido.
texts.en: Teresita is a woman who is convinced that the natural products she sells are efficient remedies for several illnesses because she’s tried them herself and they’ve helped her counteract several health deficiencies of hers.  She wants to share this and offer others the opportunity to use them for their health’s benefit.  She’s been developing a project for some time now of selling them in a fixed locale but to do so needs a million colones (¢1.000.000) to buy more products and furnish the site where she’ll provide this service.  She states that she’s happy to have found quick and easy financial support.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Cristina esta soltera, tiene 35 años de edad, curso 1 año la educacion primaria, se dedica  a la confección de delantales típicos y fajas típicas, inicio este trabajo con un capital mínimo y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Solicita un préstamo, lo utilizara para la compra de telas típicas cortes enteros y retazos de varios colores, espera seguir produciendo mas delantales y fajas y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Cristina is 35 years old, single, and had a first grade education.  She makes different types of typical aprons and sashes and started out 15 years ago with minimal capital.  Her parents provide her encouragement.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy typical cuts of fabric cuts odds and ends of various colors.  She expects to produce more aprons and sashes to meet her customer demands.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Santos Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Santos Hilario esta casado, tiene  28 años de edad, curso los grados de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, inicio este negocio con su padre y hasta el  momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su de esposa quien se dedica a los oficio domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería, y así tener un negocio surtido con mas posibilidades de venta y mejorar sus ganancias, en el futuro quiere ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Santos Hilario is married, 28 years old and has one child. He completed his primary school education and works selling secondhand clothing.  He started this business with his father and he now has five years of experience in it.  He relies on the support of his wife, who takes care of the household work.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and better stock his business.  It will then be possible for him to sell more items and improve his profits.  In the future he would like to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as secondhand clothing.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de 44 años de edad, es una mujer llena de sueños y retos, Desde su infancia siempre fue apasionada por las manualidades y la decoración, arte que desarrolló en el transcurso de su juventud. Laboró en varias tiendas naturistas y decorativas en el municipio de Bello, Colombia. Con sus ahorros decidió montar su negocio destinado a la venta de velas, esencias, flores y adornos. Labora los 7 días de la semana de 8 de la mañana a 7 de la noche. María, se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio debido a que con el puede generar ingresos para su hogar y apoyar a su hijo menor en sus estudios, Además porque ha podido generar un empleo. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará artículos para decoración navideña con el fin de incrementar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su condición económica y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 44 years old and is a woman full of dreams and challenges.  She has had a passion for crafts and decorations since she was a little girl and developed it during her childhood.  She worked in various naturalist and decoration stores in the town of Bello, Colombia.

She decided to use her savings to start a business of her own, selling candles, essences, flowers, and decorations.  She works seven days a week from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  Maria is very satisfied with her business because it allows her to generate income for her household and support her son with his studies.  It also allowed her to create employment.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy Christmas decorations so she can increase her sales and generate greater income that she will use to improve her family’s financial situation and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
El señor esta casado, tiene 55 años de edad, curso los grados de educacion básica, tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al crianza y venta de animales, tales como toros, chivos, y cerdos, inició este trabajo siendo empleado y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposa quien se dedica a los oficio domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo, lo utilizara para la compra de ganado toros pequeños para crianza, ya que quiere tener varios animales y cuando sean grande venderlos y tener buena ganancia. Espera en el futuro tener un pequeña granja.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 55 years old and married.  He has a basic education and he has five children, all of whom are studying.  He breeds and sells animals such as bulls, kids and pigs.  He started as a worker and now has eight years of experience.  He receives support from his wife who looks after the household.

He is looking for a loan to buy young bulls to raise.  He would like to have various animals and, when they are older, he will sell them and make a good profit.  He hopes to own a small farm one day.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom resides in a rural village located in the Ratanak Mondul district, Battambang province. She is 55 years old and widowed with four children. To survive and support her family, she has been farming rice and planting sesame and cassava for about 10 years. Through her current business, she earns about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Mom has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles and she has completely repaid her previous loans, which have helped her to afford sufficient food to feed her family and save for future. After previous successful loans, she feels empowered and is confident to improve her standard of living. She is now requesting another loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor to help her with cultivation. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cornelio Natanael

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio Natanael esta casado, tiene 31 años de edad, curso los grados de educacion diversificada, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al prestar sus servicios de taxista, inicio este trabajo como piloto operarios para otra persona y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con al  apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo, para utilizarlo en la compra de un juego de llantas para su vehículo, ya que quiere brindar el mejor de los s4erkvicios a sus clientes, en el futuro quiere contar con mas vehículos a su cargo y propiedad.
texts.en:
Thirty-one year old Cornelio Natanael is married and has a good education.  He has two children, both of whom are studying.  Cornelio drives his own taxi, having started as a driver for somebody else.  He now has five years of experience and is supported by his wife who looks after the home.

Cornelio is looking for a loan to buy a set of tyres for his vehicle, as he would like to offer the best possible service to his customers.  In the future he would like to own and manage more vehicles.

loans.use: to buy a set of tyres.

loans.name: Saroeub

texts.en:
Saroeub is 22 years old and married.  She resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district with her husband and two small children, both of whom are too young for schooling.  For the past five years, she has earned a living through farming rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland as her main business.  Her husband works as a paid worker to help supplement family’s income.  Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Saroeub has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle and she successfully used her previous loan to sufficiently feed her family.  To support her family’s business, she is applying for another loan of 2,500,000 KHR with VisionFund and she will use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a larger profit so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Khan is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are dependent on her and still in school locally. For the last fourteen years, Khan and her husband have been cultivating rice to make a living. To better support the family and to supplement the family’s income, her husband buys and sells cows too. The current business earns her about KHR 17,800 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 7,800 each day for their future needs.

This is the Khan’s second loan from VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which helped her support her business. Now she is taking out another loan of KHR 2,300,000 to buy a small machine to generate electricity for her family’s consumption. This loan will enable her to have access to electricity for consumption and also enable her children to study at night.

loans.use: to buy a small electric generator to light her home and permit her children to study at night.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Yat is 48 years old and married. Four of her children are still her dependents and are in school locally. To support her big family, she and her husband have been cultivating rice for about seventeen years, and she supplements her family’s income by raising pigs. The current business earns her about KHR 36,000 per day to support the family, and she can save about KHR 26,000 each day for future needs. 

This is Yat’s second loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back her first loan from VisionFund, and she used her first loan to support her business and extend her farmland. With the improved business, she is asking for another loan of KHR 2,000,000 from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy a hand tractor (walking tractor) for her farming business and use a portion of it to pay for farm labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her production, so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living and also keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor (walking tractor) for her farming business.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Age 32, Doeun is a married mother of three children residing in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Like other villagers, Doeun is a rice farmer in her local area to support her family. She has been in this business for about ten years. The main challenge for her family’s business is a lack of working capital. 

Doeun has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles, and she has completely paid back her past loans from VisionFund. To face her challenge, she is requesting another loan from VisionFund, of US$250. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good profit to allow her to live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sim is 40 years old, married, and has three children. For the last ten years, she has been working as a paid worker to make a living, and she also raises cows for supplementary income. 

Sim has already been a member of VisionFund for one cycle, and she successfully used that loan to make her life better. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 1,200,000 from VisionFund, which she will use to buy soil to build up her house compound. With this loan, she hopes to make her house a decent place to live in.

loans.use: to buy soil to build up her house compound.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is 58 years old and married with six children. Her family resides in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. For the last thirty years, she has been farming rice as her main source of income. 

Neang’s borrower group consists of three members who live in the same village. This will be Neang's fifth loan request while the others have been with VisionFund from one to five cycles. She successfully used her previous loans to improve her standard of living. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan through VisionFund. Neang will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields, and she also hopes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is in her late 40s and has been successful at her business activity for the last 20 years. She lives in a little village not far from a northern Albanian town. She is married and has four children, with two of whom are still attending school.

This is the second loan for her; she established her agricultural business in viticulture with the first one. With the loan she is requesting now from Kiva lenders, she will invest in a fence around her vineyard.

Vitore has been selling grapes and wine to local markets and has built a steady clientele. Her income is the only one in her family, yet it has been good, and she has been able to provide more than the basics to her children.

loans.use: to put a fence around her vineyard.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
A widow from a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Chanthou is 38 years old. For the last ten years, she has been farming rice and planting sugarcane to make her living. Her current business earns her about KHR 22,000 per day and she can manage to save about KHR 9,000 each day for her future needs.

Chanthou is the leader of a borrower group consisting of three members who live in the same village. This will be Chanthou's fourth loan while her group members are in their fifth and third loan cycles. She successfully used her previous loans to improve her standard of living. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, which she hopes will help her to increase her crop yields and further improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 55 years old and married.  She has two adult children and she lives with them in the northwest part of the country.  For about eight years now, Marie has been selling milk and baby calves to locals and has been able to establish a steady clientele and income.  Everyday she milks and feeds the cows and takes the milk to a nearby city.
