Marie had previous loans from the same institution that helped her buy the milk cows and she has repaid them in full.  Now she is requesting another loan for a different reason.  Because the number of cows she owns has increased, she will use this loan to expand the stable.

Marie expressed her deep appreciation of VisionFund Albania and said that without their help, she would never have a life like the one she currently has.  Kindly note that, due to the rainy weather, Marie's picture was taken in front of her house rather than at the stable.

loans.use: to expand an existing animal stable.

loans.name: Maline's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district, Maline is the 36-year-old mother of five children, one daughter and four sons. Rice farming has been her main source of income for ten years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for her future needs. 

Maline is the leader of a group of two borrowers who live in the same village. She is in her fourth loan cycle while her group member is a seven-time client of VisionFund. Maline successfully used her previous loans to improve her standard of living. She will use her portion of the current loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income, and she also hopes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Soeut's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Soeut is 46 years old and married with one son who has his own employment. She has been a paid worker in her local community for twenty years. Her husband is a fisherman. Together they can earn about KHR 21,000 per day, and they manage to save about KHR 4,000 each day for their future needs.

Soeut is the leader of a borrower group consisting of four members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles while her group members have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. Soeut will use her portion of the loan to buy a fishing net for her husband’s business and to repair her motorbike. She hopes this loan will increase her family’s business so they can earn a larger income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net for her husband’s business and to repair her motorbike

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to make meals and noodles for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Huong hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to make meals and noodles for selling.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 25-year-old married mother of three little children, with the youngest being only four months old. Silvana is photographed here with her oldest child. Throughout her interview with one of the loan officers from VisionFund Albania, she did not stop for one second showing her love for her children and the happiness she got from them.
Silvana lives with her husband and in-laws according to northern Albanian traditions and they run a service business together as well. They have been operating a barber shop for a long time and their clientele has been growing steadily.
Silvana is requesting a loan to purchase electrical appliances for her new home.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal is a 48-year-old married villager and the father of five school-aged children.  He has been operating a livestock business for almost seven years, selling milk and baby calves to local residents.  He says that this activity has been a great help to him and his family who have no other income but this one.  The business of selling his cows’ milk has been steady, Pal said. 

Pal now wants to add goats as well, so that he can produce delicious goat cheese that is required in the market.  The geographic location in which he lives also favors this kind of animal.  Pal hopes that his income would double soon with the purchase of goats. 

This is Pal’s third loan and he has fully repaid the previous ones.  According to VisionFund Albania staff, Pal ended his first interview by wishing everyone, including Kiva lenders, happy holidays.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Estela Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Estela Josefina esta casada, tiene 46 años de edad, curso los grados de educacion diversificada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 4 están estudiando, se dedica a  la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres, hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Solicita un préstamo, que tendrá como destino, la compra de hilos de varios colores, ya que su trabajo tiene demanda y quiere que tal negocio sea una gran empresa. Apoyando así a mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Estela Josefina, 46, is married and has four children who are students.  She completed secondary-level courses.  She makes a living as an artisan of textiles in traditional styles, a business she started thanks to her parents' support.  At the moment she has 15 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who's a merchant.

She's requesting a loan to buy thread in a variety of colors.  Her work is in demand and she wants her business to be a great endeavor so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread for textiles

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es: El señor Héctor es una persona dedicada y responsable en su trabajo indican sus compañeros. Se dedica al servicio de transporte interprovincial, de Ivirgarzama a Cochabamba y de Cochabamba a Ivirgarzama. El cliente trabaja hace más de 5 años en este rubro, vive en concubinato y es padre de 2 hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su formación y educación junto con su pareja. Vive en una casita a medio construir, con dos  dormitorios, una cocina y un baño. Se levanta muy temprano todos los días para alistar a sus hijos y  llevarlos a la escuela. Es un padre atento y cariñoso con sus hijos, su mujer se dedica a las labores de casa y atiende a sus hijos y a don Héctor. Don Héctor se gana la vida realizando viajes 3 veces por semana, y necesita cambiar el motor de su vehículo para  poder trabajar más días a la semana, con esto él quiere  mejorar la  calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Héctor is a dedicated and responsible person with his job, say his friends.  He makes a living through long-distance transportation service, from Ivirgarzama to Cochabamba and from Cochabamba to Ivirgarzama.  He has worked for more than five years in this field.

He lives with his partner and is the father of two children whom he supports and helps in their growth and education together with his partner.  He lives in a little house that is under construction, with two bedrooms, a kitchen, and one bath.  He gets up very early every day in order to prepare his children and take them to school.  He is a very attentive and caring father with his children.  His wife devotes herself to housework and taking care of the children and Don Héctor .  

Don Héctor earns a living by making trips three times per week and needs to change the engine of his vehicle in order to be able to work more days during the week.  With this he wants to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Manuela Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Cristina esta casada, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típico, inicio este trabajo siendo trabajadora para otro negocio, lo que hasta el momento lleva 13 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo, para la compra de hilos y tinta para tejido de cortes, ya que actualmente tiene trabajadores, pero en el futuro espera tener mas telares, para brindar empleos a otras personas.
texts.en:
Manuela Cristina, 40 years old, is married and has three children who are in school. She did not have the opportunity to go to school herself. She works by making traditional woven clothing. She started this business by working for another business, and now she has 13 years experience.

She is requesting this loan to buy thread and dye for weaving clothing. Currently, she has employees but in the future she hopes to have more looms so that she can provide jobs to more people.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving.

loans.name: Choern

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Choern is aged fifty and living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school.

To feed her family, she grows cassava as the main source of the family’s income and she has been in this business for fifteen years. Her husband also supplements the income by working for others for a fee.

Choern has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her in relieving her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thoen's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Battambang province of Cambodia, Thoen is a 39 years old married mother of four children. Three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Thoen and her husband have struggled to make a living through farming rice for the last 10 years. She has also worked as a paid construction worker in the local area. Together, they earn approximately KHR 26,000 per day to meet their family’s needs.
 
Thoen’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. Thoen has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to request another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to spend on labor costs for the rice harvest. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy so that she can sell the rice for a good price.

loans.use: For labor costs involved in harvesting rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams and metal roofing

loans.name: Phoern

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Phoern is a 40-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from planting cassava and selling bananas by motor in a local area. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

This is the fourth loan for Phoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped her relieve her family's burden and support her children’s education. Now she is requesting for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy a new motorbike for her banana selling business and use a portion of it to spend on buying fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to spend on buying fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district
